text: How to place better stop losses. Has this ever happened to you? You see the price coming to a key support from where it bounced off earlier. You have the idea to buy at this level as you expect the price to bounce. Turns out, you were right, buttttt right before the price went up, your stop loss got hit, making this a losing trade rather than a winning one. Many traders place their stoploss right below the support level. While this is the right idea, its likely to get stopped out a lot. To fix this, go to recent history of the chart, and see other key levels around this area. This will give you a range, rather than a single level. Set your stop loss right below this range, and you won t get stopped out as much. If you don t want to guess how low to put your stop loss. Use the ATR indicator. It s the average true range, and will take the average price movement from the past candles. Just take this number it gives you and subtract it from the support level. This is where you should place your stop loss.
